intro: Ranunculus regularis, commonly known as the common buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers with numerous petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with palmately divided leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. The flowers bloom from spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
